description.narrative: This is a five-year, multi-stakeholder programme that aims to support the country sustain efforts towards strengthening institutional capacities and frameworks for strengthening good governance and deepening democratic participation.

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).

description.narrative: - # of laws passed - # of analytical reports produced -availability of analyzed tools for oversight function - availability of analyzed tools for parliamentary outreach - availability of study document on human resource - availability of tools for perception survey -# of MPs and parliamentary staff whose skills enhanced on various subjects - availability of study document on oversight tools -%age of the completion of the establishment of digital and paper free system -# of DIF fully institutionalized and functional -# of platforms created for stakeholders to dialogue on draft legal frameworks - # of operational tools/manuals adopted and operationalzed (EHRC) -Availability of training needs assessment report and training package -# of beneficiaries of the free legal aid services -# of human rights report produced -Availability of document on maladministration and possible solution -# of fora held involving leadership of political parties (NEBE) -Availability of comprehensive national conflict mapping and peace building document (HoF) -Availability and use of operational manual (CCI) -Availability of codified federal laws -Availability of translated federal laws into local languages -Full functioning of the coordination structures of the NHRAP -Production of monitoring and progress reports -Availability of youth and child ethics strategy -Availability of National anti-corruption perception policy (FEACC) -Established peace council to serve as platforms of public participation in peace building (MOP) -# of consultations, dialogue and conferences conducted -# of faith based networks, capacities and systems built -Availability of a media and communication assessment report

comment.narrative: -NA -None - No tools analyzed for parliamentary oversight -No tools for outreach analyzed -None - None (tools for perception survey) -NA -None -initial assessment to establish digital and pager free system for HoPR - DIF (Democratic Institutions Forum) established at federal level but needs to be institutionalized and strengthened - None - None (EHRC) -None - 82,000 beneficiaries of legal aid services -None -0 (EIO) -None (NEBE) -No comprehensive national conflict mapping (HoF) -No operational manual and case flow management system -No codified federal laws (OAG) -None of the federal laws translated into local languages (OAG) - NHRAP developed and implementation launched; but yet to be implemented -180 UPR accepted recommendations for implementation -None (FEACC) -None -No national peace council (MoP) -One national conference; No regional and local conference (MoP) -No faith based networks established -None (EBA)

- Develop one guideline for parliamentary support mechanisms of the House of Peoples Representative - Develop one standard tool for parliamentary oversight of the Defense and Security Sector of the Standing Committee of the parliament - Develop one guideline on civic engagement to facilitate active participation of the public - Upgrade computerized database center of EHRC - Revamp four free legal aid centers - Develop own mission investigation manual of EIO - Undertake national conflict mapping (HoF) - Undertake assessment on constitutional interpretation - Undertake two review assessment mechanism on effective constitionalism - Develop 1 code of conduct for public prosecutors (OAG) - 1 hot line(OAG) - conduct 9 awareness raising session on gender based violence - One resolution on NHRAP tabled and negotiated -1 policy and strategy document on anti-corruption(FEACC) -1 survey report -1 study report on mining sector - 3 forums conducted on anti-corruption -conduct 1 national and 10 regional dialogue forums (MoP) - conduct 1 consultative workshop for the development of peace councils - conduct peace conference in 3 regions
-

- 1 guideline for parliamentary support developed (HoPR) -1 oversight tool for defense SC developed - 4 free legal aid centers revamped -1 own mission investigation manual developed (EIO) -1 code of conduct for public prosecutors conducted (OAG) - 4 awareness session raised on gender based violence (OAG) - 1 resolution on NHRAP negotiated (OAG) - 1 policy and strategy doc on anti-corruption is under development (FEACC) - 1 perception survey on corruption is under development - 1 study doc on mining sector prepared - 1 national dialogue forum conducted (MoP) - 3 peace conference conducted

-Undertake a comprehensive assessment of current law-making mechanisms and practices - Conduct on demand parliamentary research - Prepare and develop operational manual on principles and procedures on national constitutional interpretation (HoF) - Introduce technology solutions for human resources management system (EHRC) - Develop a database for the compilation of national and international legal and human rights instruments (EHRC) - Establishment and revamp of peace incubation centers in conflict prone localities and all universities (MoP) - Conduct National Peace and National consensus dialogue forums (MoP) -Translate, publish and institutionalize new laws, directives, manuals, strategies and guidelines of NEBE - Roll out and publicize the newly developed NEBEs communication strategy. - Develop video conference system for the council meeting (CCI) - Develop e-library/digital library system with CCI LOGO - Organizational reform of EBA -Basic journalist training for amateurs professionals of community radio (EBA) -Develop National Anti-Corruption Policy and Strategy (FEACC) -Conduct Ethiopia Third National Corruption Perception Survey - Review contract management and administration systems of mega public projects (FEACC) -Review UNCAC second cycle (Prevention and Asset Recovery) and develop a report -Conduct a Nation wide Own-Motion Investigation on maladministration in the selected Industrial Parks (EIO) -Establish EIOs Institutional Childrens Day-care Center to realize Institutional Gender Intervention -five awareness raising sessions on human rights complaint investigation techniques to federal and regional police officers -present Ethiopias progress report on the implementation of accepted 3rd UPR recommendations to the UN human Rights Council -Operationalize Ethiopias National Recommendations Tracking Database for human rights (OAG) -Upgrade/strengthen database management system of OFAG with IT equipment, software development -Upgrade/strengthen the Audit Training Institute (ATI) for effective and efficient delivery of OFAG -

- Developed 1 assessment document on current law-making mechanism - Produced Four Parliamentary on-demand/action-oriented research assignments, - Developed a Parliamentary Civic Engagement Framework/Guide (HoPR) - Produced assessment document on civic engagement in parliamentary work - Produced assessment/reform document and developed mechanisms/frameworks on national constitutional interpretation, fairness of SPG fiscal transfer and infrastructural distributions (HoF) - Revamped peace incubation centers in conflict prone localities and all universities - Developed guideline/manuals and published new laws for election - Rolled out and publicized communication strategy of NEBE - Developed new electoral law into braille and video, audio, and sign languages - Developed video conference system for CCI - Developed and validated national Anti-Corruption Policy and Strategy (FEACC) - Developed and validated 3rd National Corruption Survey - Enhanced capacity on implementation, monitoring and reporting on UNCAC review recommendations on two areas- corruption prevention and asset recovery (FEACC) - Conducted Own-Motion to investigate grievances of employees in Industrial Parks in three Regions (EIO)

- Develop a guideline on legislation (HoPR) - Publish a standardized oversight guideline - Develop content outlines for induction and sharing lessons - Digitalize the documentation system of the Parliament -- Produce and publish parliamentary guidebook for new member of parliament (2020 entrants) -- Develop Code of conduct for higher public officials

- Developed Legislative Manual that sets out the details of the Federal law-making process - Published a standardized oversight guideline - Developed Induction and Lessons sharing manual for New Entrant MPs (HoPR) - Produced a parliamentary guidebook for new MPs of the parliament - Installed system on digitization of the House’s documentation - Conducted a Parliamentary Gender Audit (of both the House as an entity and the Secretariat) - Developed Code of Conduct for higher public officials - Developed system in new compute for Declaration of Asset Registration System (DARS) (FEACC) - Developed procedural manuals, charters, and directives for improving IGR (MoP) - Established Community, youth, Women, elders, and student’s peace forums at different levels - Upgraded free call Centre and case-flow management system for improving service delivery (CCI) - Developed Gender Mainstreaming manual (CCI) - Developed manual on human rights impact assessment (OAG) - Developed the 3rd NHRAP drawing on the inputs received from the stakeholders (OAG) - Developed papers about rights to adequate housing and the right to work and workers’ rights (EHRC)
